talk.author: did:plc:3rxcq5wacdop5thjoh3sny3p
talk.utter: Honestly, I really do. I just want like a year of something that doesn't take my entire body, mind, and soul like the last decade did so I can finish my silly sci-fi books and maybe a narrative nonfiction story or two, and then maybe I can get back to whatever journalism looks like after that

talk.author: did:plc:gmogzdvsnfmsr33naynmchxn
talk.utter: FWIW, disinformation research is also a rapidly growing area of infosec (although it may be that you want a bit of distance from it right now). It'd definitely be relevant experience for a lot of roles in the industry.

talk.author: did:plc:3rxcq5wacdop5thjoh3sny3p
talk.utter: It would be nice to do with, like, resources. We did all we did over at TruthOrFiction with three people these last five years and no budget whatsoever other than our salaries. I feel like we worked miracle after miracle that way but I sure am ready for a bit more stability

talk.author: did:plc:3rxcq5wacdop5thjoh3sny3p
talk.utter: Holy shit I can't believe how much is out there now that I've adjusted my search terms. I appreciate you so much

talk.author: did:plc:2bejacqnlm36xsrjvwzzxk2g
talk.utter: I'm looking to make a similar career move, what sites are you using and what are you searching for? I'm also coming from academia so there are particular issues I'm dealing with

talk.author: did:plc:3rxcq5wacdop5thjoh3sny3p
talk.utter: I'm using Indeed primarily, it's the least awful job board I can find so far. I tried a few others but most of them are like ZipRecruiter, which made me want to die, so I'm sticking with Indeed for now. My brand-new job search terms are "threat analyst," "disinformation," and "cognitive threats"

talk.author: did:plc:3rxcq5wacdop5thjoh3sny3p
talk.utter: Earlier I was looking for "editor" or "journalist," which apparently means either "bombard my email with internship offers" OR "get through three pages of the application process before those cheap fucks reveal it's for a 'volunteer position'"
